VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Allow a B2B Commerce for Visualforce Guest Buyer to Browse Your Storefront

If your solution allows a guest user to browse the storefront anonymously without registering for an account, be sure to provide a smooth experience for guest buyers. Enable the required permissions, sharing rules, and other settings so that a guest buyer can access certain storefront data and features.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Permissions for Guest Users

When you set up a storefront, you verify and assign permissions to the Experience Cloud site's guest users. Make sure that you complete the steps in Assign Permissions for Storefront Guest Users.

Default Owner for Records Created by a Storefront Guest User

A required Digital Experiences setting, Assign new records created by guest users to the default owner, restricts a guest user from owning any sObject records. This setting affects B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects, such as CC Carts. To comply with the requirement, create a user record that serves as the default owner of all records a guest user creates. Make sure that you complete the steps in Create a Default Owner for Records Created by a Storefront Guest User.

Sharing Settings and Sharing Rules for Guest User Access

When you set up a storefront, you configure sharing settings and rules that determine which data is publicly available to a guest user. These settings and rules ensure that a guest user has only the minimum access necessary and that their access is as restrictive as possible by default. Make sure that you complete the steps in:

Configure External Sharing Settings for Storefront Users
Create Sharing Rules for Guest User Access to Storefront Objects
Guest Buyer Account and Account Group

When a guest is browsing your storefront, they're assigned to the following records by default:

Account
CCAnonymous
Account Group
Anonymous

B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides an option for changing the default account for a guest buyer:

On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Global Settings (1).
In the Global Settings menu, select Settings (2).
Enter a different value for Anonymous Account Name (3).
Click Save (4).
IMPORTANT
Use caution when changing this default value. Several sharing rules that grant guest user access to storefront data reference this account name. We recommend that you leave this default value unchanged.
If you do change the default account or account group for a guest buyer, manually clear your org's Platform Cache partition for B2B Commerce for Visualforce data.
Product and Price Entitlements for a Guest Buyer

To ensure that a guest buyer can view products and prices on your storefront, create a price list that's assigned to the Anonymous account group. For most storefronts, the storefront's base price list specifies the price that a guest buyer can see for each product. Usually, this price is the product's list price. For more information, see Specify Your Storefront's Base Price List.

Guest Buyer Access to Carts, Checkout, and Other Features

You can fine-tune the access that a guest user has on your storefront. For example, you can specify one of the following experiences for a guest buyer:

A guest buyer can browse and self-register, but can't add products to a cart or complete checkout
A guest buyer can browse, self-register, and add products to a cart, but can't complete checkout
A guest buyer can browse, self-register, add products to a cart, and complete checkout

Configure sharing settings and rules that determine which data is publicly available to a guest user, based on the features that you allow the guest buyer to access. These settings and rules ensure that a guest user's access to your storefront is as restrictive as possible by default: they can access only the minimum data necessary. Make sure that you complete the steps in:

Configure External Sharing Settings for Storefront Users
Create Sharing Rules for Guest User Access to Storefront Objects
Allow a B2B Commerce for Visualforce Guest Buyer to Maintain a Cart
Allow a B2B Commerce for Visualforce Guest Buyer to Check Out
Internationalized Storefront Experience for a Guest Buyer

If your storefront supports multiple locales, you can localize the guest buyer's storefront session. For more information about how the guest buyer's locale is determined, see Translate Storefront Text for Buyers in Different Locales.
